title: A Divided Israel Unites in Joy as Hostages Come Home
summary: With the release from Gaza of the last surviving captives, many Israelis said it was time for the country to heal after years of polarizing war.

title: Cheering Crowds Greet Palestinian Prisoners Freed by Israel
summary: “We were happy for our prisoners — and for the Israelis, too,” one Gaza resident said. “We love peace and the truce.”

title: Palestinians See Little to Celebrate Even Though the Bombs Have Stopped
summary: The cease-fire in Gaza has taken hold. Hostages and prisoners have been exchanged. But amid the utter devastation of two years of war, a sense of gloom pervades.

title: Part Enabler, Part Buffer: The Bind of the Justice Dept.’s No. 2
summary: Todd Blanche, the deputy attorney general, has helped usher in President Trump’s retribution campaign. But he faces anger on the right for resisting some of the most extreme measures.

title: Several News Outlets Reject Pentagon’s Reporting Restrictions
summary: The Washington Post, The New York Times, Newsmax and others said their journalists would not agree to the Defense Department’s policies on news gathering ahead of a Tuesday deadline.

title: North Carolina Republicans Plan to Redraw Congressional Map to Add a Seat
summary: The Trump administration has pushed Republican leaders to redraw House district maps before the midterm elections next year. His party already holds 10 of North Carolina’s 14 congressional seats.

title: The Rules of Investing Are Being Loosened. Could It Lead to the Next 1929?
summary: A group of financiers is trying to convince the public to invest heavily in private equity and crypto — a risky gambit with some real 1920s vibes.

title: Tim Curry’s Memoir “Vagabond” Recalls an Exciting Career Interrupted by Illness
summary: A 2012 stroke has largely kept him from acting, but not from writing — and recording — a new memoir. “It was very peculiar not to be able to speak,” he says.

title: Rama Duwaji, Zohran Mamdani’s Wife, Could Become the New York’s First Lady Before Her 30th Birthday
summary: Rama Duwaji moved to the city to pursue a career in art, met a guy named Zohran Mamdani online, married him, and now could become the city’s first lady before her 30th birthday.

title: Dozens Are Dead and Dozens More Missing as Catastrophic Rains Devastate Mexico
summary: Torrential rains set off deadly floods and landslides across five Mexican states, leaving a trail of destruction.

title: Doug Lebda, LendingTree C.E.O. and Founder, Dies in ATV Accident
summary: Mr. Lebda died on Sunday following an all-terrain vehicle accident on his family’s North Carolina farm, a company spokeswoman said.

title: Diane Keaton Defied Beauty Standards
summary: For many of her fans, she was like a rare bird soaring from bygone days when progress and growing freedoms for women seemed inevitable.

title: Woody Allen Remembers the ‘Magical’ Diane Keaton
summary: “I made movies for an audience of one, Diane Keaton,” Allen wrote in a remembrance that reflected on the breadth of their relationship.

title: Diane Keaton’s Only Documentary Was About the Afterlife
summary: Keaton, who died on Saturday, was an actor, director and producer on multiple films and series. Her sole documentary, “Heaven,” explored popular ideas of the afterlife.

title: Madagascar’s President Goes Into Hiding
summary: The move followed weeks of intense and deadly protests against the government of President Andry Rajoelina, who said he would defy growing calls to resign.

title: Miami Says Farewell to Its Seaquarium
summary: The aquatic park, a South Florida landmark for 70 years and also the subject of complaints over animal rights, drew visitors on Sunday before closing for good.

title: Marc Maron on the End of the “WTF” Podcast
summary: The comedian, actor, and former podcaster discusses his decision to bring “WTF” to a close after 16 years and interviewing its final guest, Barack Obama.

title: When I Look at Zohran Mamdani, Here’s What I See
summary: What does it means to be a “good” Muslim in America?

title: Why So Many Gen Z-ers Are Drawn to Conservative Christianity
summary: And what that might mean for the future of American politics.

title: Cuban Dissident Leader Leaves Prison for Exile in the U.S.
summary: José Daniel Ferrer said long periods in solitary confinement left him feeling buried alive. Secretary of State Marco Rubio welcomed his arrival in Miami.

title: In L.A., a Former Ally of Mayor Bass Will Run Against Her
summary: The former supporter, Austin Beutner, who once ran the city’s public schools, announced he will challenge Ms. Bass’s re-election bid in next year’s mayoral race.

title: Milton Esterow, Who Reported on Art Stolen in World War II, Dies at 97
summary: At The New York Times and then ARTnews, which he bought, he brought an investigative edge to stories about artwork looted by the Germans during World War II and the Soviets afterward.
